newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia PM says H1 GDP rose over 1 pct-Interfax.
newsitem.headline: Russia PM says H1 GDP rose over 1 pct-Interfax.

text.p: Russian Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin said gross domestic product had grown slightly more than one percent in the first half of the year, the first rise since reforms began, Interfax news agency said on Wednesday.
"This has happened for the first time in five years of reforms," it quoted him as saying.
Chernomyrdin, addressing a science awards ceremony in Moscow, did not give a basis for his calculation.

The State Statistics Committee said last month that gross domestic product (GDP), the widest indicator of economic output, had fallen 0.2 percent in the first five months of the year compared to a year ago.
May GDP fell 0.4 percent on a year earlier, although it grew 0.8 percent on April's level.
Many Russian officials have said growth initially expected this year would occur only in 1998. They have generally forecast flat output in 1997.
